title: Operator Daily Maintenance of Crawler Tractors

tasks.task: Perform pre-start checks on a crawler tractor.
subtasks: Walk around the tractor to inspect for damaged or worn parts.
Inspect the dozer blade, push frame, cutting edges, and end bits for wear.
Check sprocket teeth, pins, and bushings for wear.
Check rollers for flatness and smoothness.
Check for fluid leaks in tracks, blade angle, lift cylinders, and engine compartment.
Inspect battery for proper connection and fluid levels.
Check air filter pre-cleaner and clean if necessary.
Check the engine coolant, oil, and hydraulic fluid levels.
Record the current hour meter reading.

tasks.task: Conduct a warm-up check before operating the tractor.
subtasks: Ensure all persons are clear of the tractor before starting the engine.
Start the engine and let it warm up for 5-10 minutes.
Check engine panel gauges for normal operation.
Test the steering clutches and brakes.
Check the operation of the dozer and ripper attachments.

tasks.task: Perform daily operating checks while working.
subtasks: Monitor engine and equipment noises for unusual sounds.
Check gauges regularly for safe operating ranges.
Adjust track tension as needed to prevent over-tightness or looseness.
Look for signs of track wear or fatigue.

tasks.task: Conduct a shutdown check before parking the tractor.
subtasks: Park the tractor on a level surface.
Rest all attachments on the ground and set the parking brake.
Idle the engine for about five minutes before shutdown.
Fill the fuel tank and clean the filling area.
Lubricate all mechanical joints as per the manufacturer's guidelines.
Clean dirt and debris from the tracks, attachments, and other surfaces.
